channel.title: AP News - US News
channel.description: Top US News stories from AP News

item.title: Washington attorney general and sheriff who helped nab Green River Killer fight for governor’s seat
item.description: SEATTLE (AP) — Washington state’s longtime attorney general and a former sheriff known for his work hunting down the Green River Killer are vying to become the next governor of a Democratic stronghold that hasn’t had an open race for the state’s top job in more than a decade.

item.title: Chinese businesses hoping to expand in the US and bring jobs face uncertainty and suspicion
item.description: In 2022, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer welcomed a Chinese battery company’s plan to build a $2.36 billion factory and bring a couple thousand jobs to Big Rapids.

item.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says he left a dead bear in Central Park as a prank
item.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. once retrieved a bear that was killed by a motorist and left it in New York’s Central Park with a bicycle on top, sparking a mystery that consumed the city a decade ago.
